info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 4:24PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Macon, west central Jackson and south central Swain Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 423 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Bryson City, or 6 miles west of Dillsboro, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bryson City, Dillsboro, Alarka, Savannah, Cowee and Whittier. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
